duties_responsibilities.duty: Lead, direct, and actively participate in freight processing, merchandising, and storeroom organization standards within the store.
Manage and provide direction to store associates in various aspects of the merchandising process, including freight prep, truck unload, stocking, re-lays, financial management, and inventory control.
Lead activities related to truck unload, freight flow, backroom organization, ticketing merchandise, stocking shelves, and reconciliation of inventory transactions.
Establish plans to accomplish merchandising initiatives and achieve defined goals, utilizing company tools, reports, and feedback to effectively analyze trends and refine plans.
Maintain the appearance of the store’s interior and exterior to standards, primarily regarding merchandise presentation and signage.
Participate in the interviewing, selection, hiring, and training of associates, and complete performance evaluations as directed.
Administer appropriate disciplinary action to associates, including recommendations for termination, in partnership with the store leadership and in accordance with company guidelines.
Assist with store scheduling and payroll processes on a daily and weekly basis, and serve in the Manager on Duty role as needed, including opening and closing the store.

Provide leadership and direction to floor associates and ensure that store, merchandising, and customer service standards are continuously met, including merchandise presentation, signage, recovery, and cleanliness.
Drive the customer experience and ensure resolution of customer issues.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma, GED, or equivalent work experience required.
